dt: {bc}the act or process of fixing {bc}the state of being fixed
{bc}something that is fixed or attached (as to a building) as a permanent appendage or as a structural part
{bc}a device for supporting work during machining
{bc}an item of movable property so incorporated into real property that it may be regarded as legally a part of it
{bc}a familiar or invariably present element or feature in some particular setting
{bc}a person long associated with a place or activity
{bc}a settled date or time especially for a sporting or festive event
{bc}such an event especially as a regularly scheduled affair

et: alteration of earlier {it}fixure{/it} (probably after {et_link|mixture|mixture}), going back to Middle English, "point of attachment," borrowed from Late Latin {it}fīxūra{/it} "action of fixing, place where a nail is fixed," from Latin {it}fīxus,{/it} past participle of {it}fīgere{/it} "to drive in, insert, fasten" + {it}-ūra{/it} {et_link|-ure|-ure} {ma}{mat|fix:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: the act or process of fixing : the state of being fixed
something that is fixed or attached (as to a building) as a permanent appendage or as a structural part
a device for supporting work during machining

dt: {bc}a part (such as a sink, toilet, faucet, etc.) that is attached to a system of pipes that carry water through a building

shortdef: a part (such as a sink, toilet, faucet, etc.) that is attached to a system of pipes that carry water through a building
